text: Vasily Egorovich Raev (1807-1870) was a Russian artist, Member of the Imperial Academy of Arts. ==Biography== Self portrait (1830) He was a serf of Mr. Kushelev, who was later released into the wild. He received his initial training at the school of painting Alexander Stupin's in Arzamas. He continued to study at the St. Petersburg Academy of Arts. In 1840 he received from the Academy the title of a class artist. He was sent abroad (1842), as a pensioner of the Academy. In Rome, in addition to painting, he studied (1847–1848) mosaic production. He returned to Russia (1849). He was recognized as an academician (1851). In 1854, he went abroad again. In the last years of his life he was engaged in painting in the Byzantine Style. Raev also became a talented teacher. His students were Ivan Aivazovsky, Mikhail Lebedev, and Alexey Bogolyubov. ==Works== Raev-Column of Alexander I.jpg Раев Василий Егорович - Портрет И. А.
